feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for New Zealand issued by MetService
feed.rights: Copyright Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited, 2025. Licensed under Creative Commons BY 4.0.

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Red
entry.summary: Severe gale northwesterlies with damaging gusts of 150 km/h in exposed places. Winds have eased further south, although gusts of up to 100 km/h are still possible until mid afternoon. Impact: Threat to life from flying items and falling trees. Destructive winds will cause widespread damage including powerlines and roofs, with dangerous driving conditions and significant disruption to transport and power supply.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 150 to 200 mm of rain. Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/h expected. Periods of heavy rain are likely to extend into Tuesday and the validity of this warning may be extended. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 120 to 160 mm of rain. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h expected from afternoon. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: On top of what has fallen, expect 60 to 90 mm of rain especially about the ranges. Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/h. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 90 to 120 mm of rain. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h expected from Sunday evening. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Upgraded to Orange Warning.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: On top of what has fallen, expect about 80 mm of rain about the main divide, and about 65 mm within 30 km farther east. Peak rates of 20 to 30 mm/h. Freezing level 2200 metres. Rain has eased further south. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: On top of what has fallen, expect about 80 mm of rain. Peak rates of 20 to 30 mm/h expected. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Validity extended by 3 hours.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale north to northwesterlies gusting 120 km/h in exposed places. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Validity extended to 3am Monday.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale northwesterlies gusting 120 km/h in exposed places. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale north to northeasterlies gusting 120 km/h in exposed places. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale north to northwesterlies gusting 120 km/h in exposed places, especially about Banks Peninsula. Winds have eased further south. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Periods of heavy rain are likely to continue into Tuesday and the validity of this watch may be extended. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Northerly winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: North to northeast winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited
